Notes.Text:
This update for bouncycastle fixes the following issues:

Version update to 1.60:

* CVE-2018-1000613: Use of Externally-ControlledInput to Select Classes or Code (boo#1100694)

* Release notes:
    http://www.bouncycastle.org/releasenotes.html

Version update to 1.59: 

* CVE-2017-13098: Fix against Bleichenbacher oracle when not
  using the lightweight APIs (boo#1072697).
* Release notes:
  http://www.bouncycastle.org/releasenotes.html
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: BouncyCastle TLS prior to version 1.0.3, when configured to use the JCE (Java Cryptography Extension) for cryptographic functions, provides a weak Bleichenbacher oracle when any TLS cipher suite using RSA key exchange is negotiated. An attacker can recover the private key from a vulnerable application. This vulnerability is referred to as "ROBOT."

Legion of the Bouncy Castle Legion of the Bouncy Castle Java Cryptography APIs 1.58 up to but not including 1.60 contains a CWE-470: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection') vulnerability in XMSS/XMSS^MT private key deserialization that can result in Deserializing an XMSS/XMSS^MT private key can result in the execution of unexpected code. This attack appear to be exploitable via A handcrafted private key can include references to unexpected classes which will be picked up from the class path for the executing application. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.60 and later.
